title: Long Read: How Smart Cities Will Transform Urban Living by 2030
introText: Cities are being reimagined with AI, sensors, and sustainable design. From Singapore to Barcelona to Kansas City, we explore how technology is reshaping urban life and what it means for the billions who call cities home.

content.content: Sensors embedded throughout urban infrastructure collect data on traffic, air quality, energy use, and public safety. AI systems optimize city services in real-time, from traffic lights to garbage collection.

Singapore's smart nation initiative has reduced traffic congestion 20% and energy consumption 15%. Barcelona's superblocks have reclaimed streets for pedestrians. Kansas City's smart lighting saves millions annually.
Ubiquitous sensors raise surveillance concerns. The challenge is balancing efficiency gains with civil liberties. Cities are experimenting with anonymization and governance frameworks.

summary: Smart cities are reshaping urban life with AI and sustainable design, improving efficiency, but raising privacy concerns as technology integrates into everyday living.
